page.title: 18DALLAM TOWERS
page.content: Dallam Towers as it is today was built in 1720,but there is a much older site which is on a prominent hill in the park.In the 18th century this site was made into a leval platform but with remains being found from Norman Times this suggests that the site was developed much earlier.It is also thought that it was originally the site of a Roman Fort.Dallam Towers was built by Daniel Wilson and he landscaped the park which surrounds the house.The descendants of Daniel still occupy the house and estate today.The house itself is a large and very impresive Manor,as was very typical of the early 1700's.Infront of the house there is a sunken garden.The gardens at the back of the Tower are also a splendid afair and are sometimes open to the public on National Garden Days.
